page.title: 07EMPLOYMENT,FARMING,ABATTOIR
page.content: {Abbey Meats}is the largest meat plant in N.I. This abattoir employs about 277 people,100 of whom work in the boning hall. Normally 500 cattle are slaughtered per day and from May to August they also daily kill 300 sheep. They get the animals from N.I. farms, cattle markets and also from Eire. They kill an animal by firing a bolt from a stun gun at its forehead and then a man called a "sticker" sticks a knife in it which allows the blood to be drained away. Two "hide pullers" then remove the hides of the animals which are sold to another factory in N.I. The carcasses are cut into pieces to be blast frozen, packed and sold. Abbey Meats export their products by ship to the U.K. and by air to Europe and the Middle East.
